contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} '''Fort Hughes''' ([[Caballo Island]], the [[Philippines]]) was part of the [[Harbor Defenses of Manila and Subic Bays|harbor defenses of Manila and Subic Bays]] built by the [[Philippine Department]] of the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] in the early 1900s. Although not mentioned directly by name, the novel ''[[Cryptonomicon]]'' depicts an assault of a similar fortress [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marine]] [[Sergeant]] Bobby Shaftoe dies assaulting in 1945. The novel's description more closely resembles Fort Drum (which was taken in a later operation) but the incendiary methods used were pioneered at Caballo island's mortar pits. ==Batteries== Fort Hughes contained the following batteries: * Gillespie (1-14" DC gun) * Woodruff (1-14" DC gun) * Craighill (2 Pits) 4 12" M1912 Mortars * Leach (2-6" DC guns) * Hooker (1-155mm gun) * Williams (2-155mm guns) * Fuger (2-3" RF guns) ==See also== *[[Harbor Defenses of Manila and Subic Bays]] *[[Geography of the Philippines]] *[[Military History of the Philippines]] *[[Military History of the United States]] == References == * McGovern, Terrance C. and Mark A Berhow ''American Defenses of Corregidor and Manila Bay 1898-1945''. [[Osprey Publishing]].
